title: Michy Batshuayi's Chelsea wonder goal proof of improved confidence as Frank Lampard's squad management vindicated
text:
On Saturday it was Christian Pulisic and in the 61st minute, on Wednesday night it was Michy Batshuayi offering up the latest evidence that Frank Lampard could not be managing his Chelsea squad much better.

Batshuayi’s wonder goal may not have been enough to stop Chelsea being eliminated from the Carabao Cup by Manchester United, but he will have finished the evening with his confidence boosted.

Pulisic had been given his chance immediately after his impact as a substitute in the Champions League victory over Ajax and took it emphatically with a perfect hat-trick against Burnley.

Batshuayi, who had scored the winner from the bench against Ajax, was forced to wait three more days for his opportunity from the start, but, like Pulisic, he took it against United.

The Chelsea fans were wondering why Lampard had left Batshuayi on the pitch, when they chanted the name of Tammy Abraham in the 57th minute.

But four minutes later they were going crazy over the man they wanted hooked, as Batshuayi proved Lampard right once again with his best goal to date in a Chelsea shirt.
description: On Saturday it was Christian Pulisic and in the 61st minute, on Wednesday night it was Michy Batshuayi offering up the latest evidence that Frank Lampard could not be managing his Chelsea squad much better.
